meanings.definition: A message transmitted by means of a heliograph.
meanings.sent1: The heliogram from the mountain signaled our safe arrival.
meanings.sent2: I received a heliogram from my friend in the military.
meanings.sent3: The heliogram arrived just in time for the rescue mission.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a heliogram, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The heliogram brought news of hope amidst the darkness.

meanings.definition: A photograph taken by means of a heliograph.
meanings.sent1: The old album contained a heliogram of my grandparents.
meanings.sent2: The heliogram captured the beauty of the sunset perfectly.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally photobombed the heliogram at the park.
meanings.sent4: The heliogram froze that moment in time forever.
meanings.sent5: The heliogram showed the world through a different lens.

meanings.definition: A device used to send messages by reflecting sunlight.
meanings.sent1: The explorers relied on the heliogram to communicate over long distances.
meanings.sent2: The heliogram was an essential tool for the expedition.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel played with the heliogram, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The heliogram was a silent messenger in the vast wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The heliogram gleamed brightly, carrying secrets across the land.
